intro: Pauletia corniculata, commonly known as the horned pauletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive horn-shaped bracts that surround its small, showy flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
